results.title: Hotel colonial (D)
results.creator_credit: Cinzia Th Torrini, Ira Barmak, Legeis Theatrical and Hemdale Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Early one morning, Marco (John Savage), an Italo-American living in America, is awoken by a phone call delivering the news of his brother’s death, Luca, a shady character involved in the Italian mafia and terrorism. Marco heads to Bogota, Columbia, where his brother allegedly committed suicide, in order to identify the body and bring him home. However, all is not what it seems when Marco discovers the body is not his brother’s and the suicide may be a murder. Marco is determined to find his brother, and based on a few clues that point him to a small village in remote Columbia, and knowledge of his brothers’ various aliases and his involvement in drug trafficking, he begins the journey of unravelling the truth. Throughout the search, Marco meets a few characters, becomes acquainted with the locals and learns to appreciate the innocence, natural beauty though indisputable poverty of this small Columbian village. However, upon closer inspection of his environment, Marco also sees the evil, corruption and exploitation that transpire in this small village. It’s only in the depths of this dark and uncivilised land that Marco confronts the true and shocking reality of his brother’s whereabouts, and that he learns its corruption is inseparable from the activities of his own flesh and blood. Despite its cliched plot scenarios and mediocre performances, “Hotel Colonial” shows some genuine concern for the plight of South American peoples though from the perspective of a white American male. Cast also includes Robert Duvall and Rachel Ward. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Hot wheels
results.creator_credit: Don McBrearty, Beryl Fox, National Film Board of Canada and McBrearty Film Productions
results.brief_description: A story where two girls turn down two boys for more prosperous dates. In anger, the teenage boys steal a car and after a drinking session accidentally meet up with the girls. The drivers of the two cars challenge each other to a race. A fictional film, dramatising a situation where pride, alcohol and wheels combine with disastrous results.

results.title: Hot water; Safety last
results.creator_credit: Fred C Newmeyer, Bob Hoag and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Versions of Comedy Classics”
This film is a new print of two old comedy films. ‘Hot Water’, made in 1924, is about Harold taking a live turkey on a trolley ride and then taking his in-laws for an equally hysterical ride in his new car. Also stars Jobyna Ralston, Josephine Crowell, Charles A. Stevenson and Mickey McBan. Written by Tommy Gray and John Grey. The second film, called ‘Safety Last’, was made in 1923 and is about Harold going to the big city to make his fortune and includes the scene “Harold Lloyd on the clock”. Also stars Mildred Davis and Bill Strothers. Written by Jean C. Havez and Sam Taylor.

results.title: Hot stuff. The Ride. Dinosaur. Rip Van Winkle
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton, Gerald Potterton, Zlatko Grgic, Colin Low, Billy Budd Films, Will Vinton Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A compilation of four excellent short films; two from The National Film Board of Canada and two from Will Vinton who pioneered clay animation. “Hot Stuff” (Canada, 1972, 10 min.): An award winning animated film about fire as the servant of man. “The Ride” (Canada, 1963, 7 min.): A slapstick comedy about a chauffeur for an eccentric tycoon chasing a runaway sled. “Dinosaur” (U.S., 1980, 14 min.): A clay animated interpretation of how earth existed before man. “Rip Van Winkle” (U.S., 1979, 29 min.) An adaptation of Washington Irving’s classic tale of a man who would rather tell stories than work in the fields.
results.title_for_label: Hot stuff. The Ride. Dinosaur. Rip Van Winkle

results.title: Hot stuff
results.creator_credit: Zlatko Grgic, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film traces man’s carelessness with fire, from its discovery to present day. Early man is warned that he must keep fire under control, but he gradually ignores this waring. Over-loaded sockets, smouldering cigarettes and other fire hazards result in the destruction of life and property. Story by Don Arioli. (Awards include: Melbourne, Toronto, New York, Atlanta, Zagreb, Chicago, Oberhausen.) Also available on DVD [319319].

results.title: Hot shots! (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jim Abrahams, Bill Badalato, Peter Miller Investment Corp and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A spoof of “Top Gun” in which Charlie Sheen stars as Topeer Harley, an ace fighter pilot who’s recruited to join a team of crack (or is it cracked?) jet jockeys for a top-secret mission Led by their incompetent commander (Lloyd Bridges). The squadron includes a half-blind pilot named ‘Wash-Out’ and a vain and smug golden boy. Together they train for operation ‘Sleepy Weasle’, a lightning strike against a desert kingdom. Meanwhile they spend their nights carousing in a nightclub where the beautiful airbase psychiatrist moonlights as a sexy chanteuse. To round out the insanity, a devious contractor is out to sabotage their mission.

results.title: Hot potato
results.creator_credit: Oscar Williams, Paul Heller, Fred Weintraub and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hot Potato is the follow up to “Black Belt Jones!” and sees Jim Kelly reprising his title role. Filmed in Thailand, the film follows the adventures of agent Jones (Kelly) who is sent to Thailand to rescue the daughter of a US Senator kidnapped by a power hungry Thai warlord. Jones teams up with local agent Pam (Irene Tsu), together with his regular sidekicks Chicago (Geoffrey Binney) and Rhino (George Memmoli). Jim Kelly who is an International Middleweight Karate Champion choreographed the film’s fight scenes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Oscar Williams, Paul Heller, Fred Weintraub and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Hot lead and cold feet
results.creator_credit: Robert Butler, Walt Disney Pictures and Ron Miller
results.brief_description: A Walt Disney comedy about a pioneer who has founded the small town of Bloodshy. With the assistance of his twin sons, Eli discovers he must fight for control of the town’s future against the town’s corrupt mayor. With Jim Dale playing the three main roles this is essentially a family oriented adventure film set in the old Wild West, replete with gunslingers and outlaws. Cast also includes Karen Valentine, Don Knotts, Jack Elam and John Williams.

results.title: Hot Fuzz
results.brief_description: As a former London constable Nicholas Angel finds it difficult to adapt to his new assignment in the sleepy British village of Sandford. However, when a series of grisly accidents rocks Sandford, Angel smells something rotten in the idyllic village.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi miniatures
constellations_other.description: As filmmaking technologies have changed and evolved over the decades, much like audiences, miniatures have endured as one of the most effective film special effects.

results.description: As a former London constable, Nicholas Angel finds it difficult to adapt to his new assignment in the sleepy British village of Sandford. Not only does he miss the excitement of the big city, but he also has a well-meaning oaf for a partner. However, when a series of grisly accidents rocks Sandford, Angel smells something rotten in the idyllic village.
